LONDON ( AP ) - The families of four missing British yachtsmen are imploring the U.S. Coast Guard to resume the search for the men , whose boat capsized in the mid-Atlantic .
The Cheeki Rafiki was returning from a regatta in Antigua when it ran into trouble about 1,000 kilometers ( 620 miles ) east of Cape Cod , Massachusetts , on Thursday .
U.S. and Canadian aircraft , assisted by three merchant vessels , scoured the ocean , but called off the search Sunday amid treacherous weather .

Graham Male , father of 23 - year - old crew member James Male , said the men could be adrift in a life raft .
